com.aisandbox.cmd

Class SandboxCommander

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aisandbox.cmd.SandboxCommander
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BalancedCommander, SimpleCommander

    public abstract class SandboxCommander
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base class for all custom AI sandbox commanders. In your own commander class you need to override the tick() method, which is called periodically from the server.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected GameInfo gameInfo
      The commander's GameInfo object
      protected LevelInfo levelInfo
      The commander's LevelInfo object
      protected java.lang.String name
      The name of this commander.
      protected boolean verbose
      Set this to true to enable the display of the bot command descriptions next to each bot.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SandboxCommander()
      Class constructor.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearCmdQueue()
      Used internally to clear the bot command queue.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCmdQueue()
      Used internally to retrieve the list of all bot commands to send to server.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Return the custom commander's name.
      void initialize()
      Called when the server sends the "initialize" message to the commander.
      void issue(BotCommand cmd)
      Issue a command for a single bot, with optional arguments depending on the command.
      boolean isVerbose()
      Whether or not command descriptions are rendered to the screen.

      Whether or not command descriptions are rendered to the screen.

      Called when the server sends the "shutdown" message to the commander.
      abstract void tick()
      Called when the server sends a "tick" message to the commander.

      Update the GameInfo object of this commander.

        public void issue(BotCommand cmd)
        Issue a command for a single bot, with optional arguments depending on the command. Command description is only rendered to screen if this commander is set to verbose.
